courses: Intro to Computer Science using Python

awards.title: Valedictorian
awards.summary: An award given by graduating top of the class constisting of over 400 students.

projects.name: Motion Controlled Remote Speaker
highlights: Designed and developed a glove that can detect motion through acceleration detectors, as well as gyroscopes to determine orientation.
Modified a Bose speaker by externally connecting its controls to a receiver.
Developed a program that interprets information sent by the glove and converts it to commands that is sent to the receiver to control the speaker in less than a second.

projects.name: Idle Clicker Game
highlights: Developed a simple game that allows users to click images of fruit in order to obtain currency.
Currency could then be used to buy upgrades that would automate currency acquisition.
The backend of the project required multiple counters and calls to functions from other files.

work.name: MIT Summer Program
work.summary: Studied online at MIT, learning about Electrical Engineering Systems and Embedded Systems as well as Engineering Journalism
highlights: Worked on several small projects, as well as the Motion Controlled Remote Speaker
